subject: Re: [junit] Output Analyzer
msgSnippet: I guess I was hoping for an established set of output checking utilities that compact nicely into assertions.
messageBody:
I guess I was hoping for an established set of output checking utilities
that compact nicely into assertions.

J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

> Goody MasDoggy wrote:
>
> > Hello
> >
> > I have a few cases where what I want to test is generating output to a
> > file or some other external output. Can anyone suggest a utility that
> > will analyze output based upon regular expressions or by comparing the
> > output against another file to ensure a match? Or is this a case of
> > write-it-your-damn-self?
>
> This description is too generic for us to give you good advice. It
> sounds like you want to check where a regular expression matches text
> from a file. So read the file and use Matcher. The "utilities" are
> already part of the JDK.
>
> So I guess you should write it your damn self. :)
> --
> J. B. Rainsberger,
> Diaspar Software Services
> http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
> Let's write software that people understand
